scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Erin
scrape.text: I've been anxious to read this for months, so I successfully wrestled Melinda Sutton's copy away from Kelli Ellis and Angela Mills Sims!Maybe Lionel Shriver did bad children so well in the stellar We Need to Talk About Kevin that anything else is bound to be slightly disappointing. The good news is that my book club will have read both of these books so it will be interesting to compare. The book is set in the Netherlands, but could really be anywhere (no fault of the author....most of it takes place over one dinner in an upscale restaurant). Definitely an interesting study on the nature of psychopathy, and a page turner, but I wanted to like it more than I did, I guess....meaning I wanted to adore it, and ended up just liking it.
